resources.string: Welcome to the Ruffier test application !

This application was created in order to assist the realization of a Ruffier test to evaluate the physical condition of a person.\n\n It is intended to work in parallel with the Ruffier test app for connected watches, in order to measure your heart rate.

To use this application with your connected watch, it must meet certain criteria:


Possess Google's Wear OS 


Have a working heart sensor 


Without these features, this application cannot be used properly.

 You can nevertheless use this application by entering values taken with an external medical tool.

This application will guide you throughout the measurement process by giving you the necessary instructions for its correct operation. 

 Once the protocol is complete, you will be informed of a Ruffier index and a Ruffier-Dickson index.

Protocol description:

 The Ruffier test or Ruffier-Dickson test is a physical test that assesses a person's ability to participate in sports. This test can be, for example, performed under the supervision of a doctor in order to obtain a medical certificate of no contraindication to a sport.

 Test procedure:

 The test takes place in 3 steps:

1. After resting (lying down) for a few minutes, taking the subject's pulse gives the value p0


2. The subject must then stand up and perform 30 complete squats in 45 seconds, arms extended in front of them. Following this period of effort, the pulse p1is immediately taken


3. The subject lies down again, and exactly one minute after the end of the squats, his heart rate is recorded for one last time p2
